concern:
Due to personal circumstances I never finished Highschool. I have been accepted into University and am due to start in July. I am terrified that I won’t be able to get good grades due to the jump in education level. 

How do I prepare for uni life so that I can do well?

(I am in Australia and it is an online computer science course)

dialogue_total.statement: Welcome, I'm here to listen and provide a supportive space for you to share your thoughts and concerns. What's on your mind today?

I'm really anxious about starting university and handling the higher level of coursework, especially since my educational background isn't traditional. I'm here to get advice on how to prepare effectively so I can succeed in my studies.

It's natural to feel anxious about starting university, especially when you're coming from a nontraditional background. It's great that you're seeking advice on how to prepare effectively. Let's explore some strategies that could help you succeed in your studies. What specifically worries you the most about the coursework?

I'm most worried about keeping up with the advanced computer science concepts, given my nontraditional educational background. I also fear that the online format might make it challenging to access the support I need to bridge any knowledge gaps.

It sounds like you're concerned about the advanced concepts in computer science and the potential lack of support in an online format. It's understandable to feel worried, but remember that universities often have resources to help students succeed, regardless of their educational background. Have you looked into any academic support services or tutoring programs that your university might offer?

I haven't fully explored the academic support services or tutoring programs yet, as I've been focused on getting my mindset right for the course. I'm eager to look into them soon, though, to help bridge any gaps from my nontraditional background and ensure I can keep up with the computer science material.

It's great that you're already thinking about how to best prepare for your university coursework. Exploring the academic support services and tutoring programs offered by your university can be a fantastic way to build a strong foundation in computer science concepts and address any gaps in your knowledge. Remember, it's not uncommon for students to need extra support, so don't hesitate to reach out and ask for help when you need it.

Thank you for the reassurance it's helpful to know that extra support is normal and available. I'm still feeling a bit anxious about jumping into the computer science material, so I'll prioritize checking out those academic services to build my confidence.

That's a wise decision. Familiarizing yourself with the academic support services will not only help you build your confidence, but it will also give you a clearer understanding of the resources available to you. Remember, you don't have to figure everything out on your ownthere are people and programs in place to help you succeed.

Thank you for the encouragementit really helps to hear that I'm not alone in needing support. I'm still working on building my confidence with the university coursework, so I'll make sure to reach out to those academic services soon to get the help I need.

It's great that you're taking steps to build your confidence and seek support. Remember, you've come this far already, and that's a testament to your resilience and determination. Keep up the positive attitude and don't hesitate to reach out for help when needed. You've got this!

Thank you for your encouragementit means a lot to know that my determination is recognized as I face this new challenge. I'm still working on managing my anxiety about the coursework, so I'll focus on reaching out to those academic services to get the support I need.
